Play:
The Courier for Hell
(Meido no hikyaku / 冥途の飛脚)

Written By: Chikamatsu Monzaemon (近松門左衛門)

First Staged: 1711

Reference: Major Plays of Chikamatsu, translated by Donald Keene, (New York: Columbia University Press, 1961); Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Bunraku February 1985 Performance Program

– Click image to view.

Performances:

November 1964: The Courier for Hell

February 1972: The Courier for Hell

October 1973: The Courier for Hell

November 1973: The Courier for Hell

October 1977: The Courier for Hell

July 1980: The Courier for Hell

February 1981: The Courier for Hell

February 1985: The Courier for Hell

October 1986: The Courier for Hell

February 1988: The Courier for Hell

December 1983 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Courier for Hell

August 1991: The Courier for Hell

February 1993: The Courier for Hell

July 1996: The Courier for Hell

Marty Gross Film Production: The Courier for Hell

Characters:

Ihei (Tedai Ihei / 手代伊兵衛)

Jinnai (Kunizamurai Jinnai / 国侍甚内)

Myokan (Haha Myōkan / 母妙閑)

Chubei (Kameya Chūbei / 亀屋忠兵衛)

Man (Gejo Man / 下女まん)

Hachiemon (Tanbaya Hachiemon / 丹波屋八右衛門)

Baggage transport manager (Sairyō / 宰領)

Supervisor of courtesans (Kasha / 花車)

Courtesan Umegawa (Keisei Umegawa / 傾城(遊女)梅川)

Courtesan Chiyotose (Keisei Chiyotose / 傾城(遊女)千代歳)

Courtesan Narutose (Keisei Narutose / 傾城(遊女)鳴渡瀬)

Girl attendant to a courtesan (Kamuro / 禿)

Jester Gohei (Taikomochi Gohei / 太鼓持五兵衛)

Palanquin bearer (Kagoya / 駕屋)

Hachiemon's messangers (Hachiemon no Tsukai / 八右衛門の使)

Rin, a maid (Nakai Rin / 仲居りん)

Tama, a maid (Nakai Tama / 仲居たま)

Horse drivers (Umakata / 馬方)
